itemDescription: British engineer, professor of applied mechanics in the Royal Naval College in Greenwich

wikipedia_page.main:
Bernard Parker Haigh, MBE (8 July 1884 – 18 January 1941) was a Scottish mechanical engineer. Haigh was educated at Allan Glen's School and the University of Glasgow He served as professor of applied mechanics at the Royal Naval College in Greenwich.
Haigh is known for his contributions in the fields of metal fatigue, welding and theory of plasticity. He is particularly known for Haigh diagram.In 1913 Haigh became a lecturer in applied mechanics at the Royal Naval College.
